Entries.default: This bowl is full to bursting with ripe koīki. It looks as if Ruāsare's attendants stock it regularly to keep pace with the ranga's appetite.
[Place the blighted koīki fruit at the top of the pile.]
You set the blighted fruit down in the bowl where it is indistinguishable from the others.
The smell overpowers the stench of the braziers which suffuses the rest of the temple.
You retrieve the blighted koīki from the pile.
These koīki smell particularly sweet and pungent, likely owing to their growth in the deeper jungle.
"This is wrong, I say. The tribe opened their home to us." Tekēhu pulls on his hair and frowns in your direction.
"This is what we came for. Do you deny it?"
"Ekera, I was holding out hope that your senses would return."
"I feel a great sorrow. Mother Ngati weeps." He smooths back his hair and grimaces down at the blighted koīki.
"Thank you, captain. This is for the best." Tekēhu nods.
"Ekera, you are the reason the Wahaki fear outsiders."
"Ekera. It is no small matter." Tekēhu lets out a weary sigh.
